result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Davon Rufus Hudson

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 10 pages) commencing 09-30-2022 by Irene Koenigs.

9:57 AM Defendant Davon Rufus Hudson in court.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Davon Rufus Hudson.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Allis Officer A. Behnke. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court orders a $1000.00 PR bond with turnover to Justice Point LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION; all previously ordered conditions of bail remain. 
-Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. 
-Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
-No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Davon Rufus Hudson appeared by video.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III for Stephen Andrew Sargent appeared by video for Davon Rufus Hudson.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for return on warrant.  Court hears arguments as to bail.  Bail motion by defense argued GRANTED by the Court.  Court reinstates signature bond set at $1000.00; court ordered Justice Point LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION; all conditions remain the same.  Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defense counsel did not appear.  Case adjourned for a return on warrant for August 25, 2022 at 10:00 am; VIA ZOOM.
Return on warrant scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Bench Warrant Cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff.  Original (Copy) bench warrant received.  Case calendared for Return on Warrant August 24, 2022 at 9:00 am.; all parties to appear by zoom.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($1,000.00 signature bond) LW
Received and Filed: Attorney Stephen Sargent
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Davon Rufus Hudson not in court.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Court ordered no contact with MJT
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Davon Rufus Hudson in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Davon Rufus Hudson in custody.  Nate K. McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Davon Rufus Hudson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case will be heard in room 503 of the courthouse. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
